In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Of course! Below is an example of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    output_string = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            output_string *= "\n" * word * " "
            line_length = length(word) + 1
        else
            output_string *= word * " "
            line_length += length(word) + 1
        end
    end

    return output_string
end

# Example usage
input_text = "This is a long example sentence that needs wrapping."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(input_text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The `wrap_string` function splits the input string into words, then iterates over the words, adding a new line whenever the maximum text width is exceeded. In this example, the input string `"This is a long example sentence that needs wrapping."` is wrapped at a maximum text width of 10.
